DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen First Aqua Collection Kit Tissue Removed Source Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the first tissue type removed for use with the aqua kit.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen First Aqua Collection Kit Tissue Removed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A light bluish-green to light greenish-blue color._A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body._Gear consisting of a set of articles or tools for a specified purpose_An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: First Aqua Tissue Collection Kit Tissue Removed
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A light bluish-green to light greenish-blue color.:A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.:Gear consisting of a set of articles or tools for a specified purpose:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A light bluish-green to light greenish-blue color.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.
Gear consisting of a set of articles or tools for a specified purpose
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
Taken out of, separated from, or eliminated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The unique identification name of the source from which a sample is derived.
